Veterans Who Receive Pay for Active Duty Training Only
Occasionally, a Veteran may
attend armory drill/training in a no-pay status, and
receive pay only for the annual, active duty training attended.
Under these circumstances, the Veteran must waive VA benefits or military pay and allowancesÂ only for the number of days of active duty training attended.
title: M21-1, Part VI, Subpart ii, Chapter 3, Section A - Adjusting Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Benefits Based on a Veteran's Receipt of Drill Pay
